facts.text: The Vancouver Whitecaps were established as an MLS team on March 18, 2009.
The Whitecaps began play in Major League Soccer in 2011 as the 17th team.
The Whitecaps became the first Canadian team to qualify for the MLS Cup playoffs in the 2012 season.
The Vancouver Whitecaps have won the Canadian Championship four times: in 2015, 2022, 2023, and 2024.
The Whitecaps reached the CONCACAF Champions Cup final once, in 2025, where they lost to Cruz Azul.
The Whitecaps' first match in the MLS era was on March 19, 2011, against Toronto FC, which they won 4-2.
Eric Hassli scored the first goal in the Whitecaps' MLS era.
Teitur Thordarson was confirmed as the head coach for the Whitecaps' inaugural MLS season on September 2, 2010.
Teitur Thordarson was relieved of his duties on May 30, 2011, after the Whitecaps won just one of their first twelve matches.
Tom Soehn replaced Teitur Thordarson as the head coach on an interim basis on May 30, 2011.
The Whitecaps attracted 15,500 season ticket holders in their first MLS season.
The Whitecaps were eliminated by Tigres UANL with a 4–1 aggregate scoreline in both the 2016–17 and 2024 editions of the CONCACAF Champions Cup.
The Whitecaps defeated the Portland Timbers 5–0 in the wild-card round of the playoffs in the 2024 regular season.
The Whitecaps were eliminated by Los Angeles FC in Round 1 of the playoffs in the 2024 regular season.
The Whitecaps were eliminated in the Round of 32 of the 2024 Leagues Cup by Pumas UNAM.
The Whitecaps won the 2024 Canadian Championship by defeating Toronto FC 4–2 on penalties after a scoreless draw.
The Whitecaps officially announced they would continue using the "Whitecaps" name with a redesigned logo on June 8, 2010.
The official club colours of the Whitecaps are navy blue ("deep sea"), white, and light blue ("Whitecaps blue").
The Whitecaps unveiled a third kit that is predominantly "arbutus brown" with sky blue accents on June 14, 2012.
The Whitecaps used a redesigned version of their 1979 kit as a 40th anniversary tribute in 2019.
The Whitecaps unveiled the Bloodlines Jersey in 2023, highlighting a partnership with Telus to support Canadian Blood Services.
The Whitecaps released The 50 Jersey on the club's 50th anniversary in 2024, creating a modern twist on the original crest from 1974.
BC Place, the home stadium of the Whitecaps, underwent a major renovation between 2009 and 2011, which included the installation of the world's largest cable-supported retractable roof.
The Whitecaps played their final match at Empire Field on September 24, 2011.
The Whitecaps played their first match at BC Place on October 2, 2011.
The National Soccer Development Centre on the UBC campus, partnered with the Whitecaps, opened on September 22, 2017.
During the COVID-19 pandemic, the Whitecaps played most of their 2021 home matches at Rio Tinto Stadium in Sandy, Utah.
The Whitecaps supporters group known as the Southsiders began in 1999.
The Southsiders' membership increased to over 1200 by July 2010.
Curva Collective, a Whitecaps supporters group, was founded after the 2011 season.
Rain City Brigade, another Whitecaps supporters group, was established in 2010.
The Vancouver Whitecaps' first all youth supporter group is called Vancouver Albion, and they are located in section 254.
The Prawnsiders became formally organized at the beginning of the inaugural MLS season in 2011.
The name "Prawnsiders" is derived from the term "prawn-sandwich brigade," which is used to describe soccer supporters who sit in the more expensive seats.
South Sisters, a group for Vancouver Whitecaps supporters who identify as female, LGBTQ2+, or allies, was officially formed in 2019.
Couch Ultras is a supporter group known for organizing tifo displays at BC Place, and it originated as a home-based group.
In 2020, the Vancouver Whitecaps introduced a new general admissions supporters section called the Village Stand in half of Section 253 and all of Section 254.
The official mascot for the Vancouver Whitecaps is Spike, a Belted kingfisher.
The Vancouver Whitecaps have longstanding rivalries with the Portland Timbers and Seattle Sounders FC, which predate MLS.
The rivalry between the Vancouver Whitecaps and the Portland Timbers dates back to 1975 in the original North American Soccer League.
The 100th match between the Vancouver Whitecaps and the Portland Timbers was played in 2017.
Vancouver's first game in MLS was against Toronto FC, marking the beginning of a rivalry intended by the league to spur competition between the two Canadian teams.
Who replaced Martin Nash as the colour commentator for Vancouver Whitecaps FC's inaugural season?
Paul Dolan
In what year did TSN take over broadcast rights for "regional" Vancouver Whitecaps games?
Who took over play-by-play duties for Vancouver Whitecaps FC broadcasts after Peter Schaad in April 2021?
Blake Price
As of 2023, which platform will only carry selected Whitecaps matches due to a new worldwide MLS broadcast deal?
Apple TV
Who replaced Paul Dolan for radio play-by-play duties prior to the 2012 MLS season?
David Norman
Who has been the majority owner of the Vancouver Whitecaps since 2002?
Greg Kerfoot
How much did the group of investors pay for the Vancouver Whitecaps' MLS expansion fee in 2009?
$35 million
What was the estimated value of the Vancouver Whitecaps according to Forbes in 2023?
$410 million
Whitecaps FC 2 began playing in the MLS Next Pro league in 2022.
Vancouver Rise FC competes in the Northern Super League, the top flight of the Canadian women's soccer league system.
The Whitecaps' women's team won the USL W-League championship in 2004 and 2006.
Bob Birarda was fired as head coach of the Whitecaps women's team in 2008 after an internal investigation into allegations of sexual abuse and misconduct.
MLS announced an independent investigation into the conduct of Bob Birarda and Hubert Busby Jr., as well as the Whitecaps organization, in late 2021.
The Whitecaps FC Academy was established in 2007.
Vancouver Whitecaps FC won the Canadian Championship in 2015, 2022, 2023, and 2024.
Vancouver Whitecaps FC were runners-up in the Canadian Championship in 2011, 2012, 2016, and 2018.
Vancouver Whitecaps FC won the Cascadia Cup in 2013, 2014, 2016, and 2023.
Vancouver Whitecaps FC qualified for the CONCACAF Champions Cup for the first time in the 2015-16 edition of the tournament.
Carl Valentine returned to Vancouver Whitecaps FC on December 7, 2010.
Vancouver Whitecaps FC announced they would make Rio Tinto Stadium and Sandy their home for the start of the 2021 season on March 10, 2021.
The lower bowl capacity at B.C. Place for Vancouver Whitecaps FC was expanded to 22,120 on March 4, 2016.
Vancouver Whitecaps FC was awarded an MLS team on March 18, 2009, for the 2011 season.
Vancouver Whitecaps FC officially joined MLS in 2011.
Vancouver Whitecaps FC became the first Canadian team to make the MLS playoffs on October 21, 2012.
Vancouver Whitecaps FC fired head coach Martin Rennie on October 29, 2013.
Vancouver Whitecaps FC and DC United joined Seattle Sounders and LA Galaxy in the 2015–16 CONCACAF Champions League as announced before October 19, 2014.
Vancouver Whitecaps FC revealed a new crest and season ticket information on June 8, 2010.
The official club colors of Vancouver Whitecaps FC include navy blue ("deep sea"), white, and light blue ("Whitecaps blue") as confirmed on June 8, 2010.
Martin Rennie served as the head coach of a team from October 26, 2011, to October 29, 2013, and is from Scotland.
Carl Robinson, from Wales, was the head coach from December 16, 2013, to September 25, 2018.
Vanni Sartini, from Italy, transitioned from interim to permanent head coach on November 30, 2021.
Jesper Sørensen, from Denmark, started his tenure as head coach on January 14, 2025.
Jay DeMerit, from the United States, was a player from 2011 to 2014.
Pedro Morales, from Chile, played from 2014 to 2016.
Russell Teibert, from Canada, played from 2020 to 2023.
Ryan Gauld, from Scotland, started playing in 2024.
The team's biggest win in the CONCACAF Champions Cup was a 5-0 victory over Real España on March 8, 2023.
The team reached the semi-finals of the CONCACAF Champions Cup in the 2016–17 season, marking their best result in the competition.
Brian White was the top goalscorer for the 2023 and 2024 seasons, scoring 15 goals each season.
Russell Teibert, a midfielder from Canada, has made 300 total appearances for the team from 2011 to 2023, making him the player with the most appearances.
The team suffered a 0-5 defeat against Cruz Azul in the final of the CONCACAF Champions Cup in 2025.
Camilo was the top goalscorer in 2013 with 22 goals.
The team finished in 3rd place in their group during the 2015–16 CONCACAF Champions Cup, marking their worst result in the competition.
